com.poesys.accounting.dataloader.newaccounting

Class Statement

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.accounting.dataloader.newaccounting.Statement

  • public class Statement
extends java.lang.Object
    An accounting statement for a fiscal year (balance sheet or income statement) that contains a set of rollups for each account in the fiscal year of a type appropriate for the kind of statement (Assets for Balance Sheet, for example).
    Author:
    Robert J. Muller

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      The types of statement supported by this program

      • Statement

        public Statement(FiscalYear year,
                 java.lang.String name,

        Create a Statement object.
        Parameters:
        year - the fiscal year of the statement
        name - the name of the statement for display
        type - the kind of statement (balance sheet, income statement)

    • Method Detail

      • getRollups

        public java.util.Map<Account,Rollup> getRollups()
        Get the rollups. This is a factory method as well as a "getter" that generates the Rollup objects for each account in the FiscalYear and puts it into a map of Rollups indexed by account. There will be one entry in the map for each account registered in the fiscal year.
        Returns:
        a Map of Rollup objects indexed by Account

      • getAccountBalance

        public java.math.BigDecimal getAccountBalance(Account inputAccount)
        Get the balance (account total) for a specified account.
        Parameters:
        inputAccount - the account for which to get the balance
        Returns:
        the balance in the account in the statement

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • toData

        public java.lang.String toData()
        Produce a data set of rollup data lines in a String suitable for writing out as a data file, with line delimiters. Note that the last line should not have a line delimiter. The accounts output depend on the type of statement, balance sheet or income statement.
        Returns:
        a data set as a String

      • appendDataLine

        private void appendDataLine(java.lang.StringBuilder builder,
                            java.lang.String delimiter,
                            Rollup rollup)
        Append a data line to a builder building an output data set.
        Parameters:
        builder - the in-progress builder
        delimiter - the line delimiter to write before the data line; possibly empty string
        rollup - the rollup to output

      • toDetailData

        public java.lang.String toDetailData()
        Produce a data set of rollup data-detail lines in a String suitable for writing out as a data file, with line delimiters. Note that the last line should not have a line delimiter. The accounts output depend on the type of statement, balance sheet or income statement. If the rollup has no items, the detail data contains no rows for the account.
        Returns:
        a data set as a String

      • appendDataDetailsLines

        private void appendDataDetailsLines(java.lang.StringBuilder builder,
                                    java.lang.String delimiter,
                                    Rollup rollup)
        Append a data details line set to a builder building an output data set.
        Parameters:
        builder - the in-progress builder
        delimiter - the line delimiter to write before the data line; possibly empty string
        rollup - the rollup to output
